title: UC announces 2015 James P. Kelly HOF class
text:
UC announces 2015 James P. Kelly HOF class 
Updated: Mon, Oct 05 2015, 05:36 PM 
CINCINNATI - The University of Cincinnati department of athletics announced a six-member class of 2015 for induction into the James P. Kelly UC Athletics Hall of Fame. 
Former student-athletes Danny Fortson (basketball), Josh Harrison (baseball), Jim Herman (men’s golf) and Maria (Oberg) Vitazka (swimming) will be honored along with contributors Dr. Nancy Hamant (academics) and Bill Walker (sports medicine). 
The annual Legion of Excellence gala will be held on Thursday, Oct. 29, in the Nippert Stadium West Pavilion. The event opens with a reception at 6:15 p.m. and dinner will be served at 7 p.m. 
In addition to the hall of fame class, Barry Bucher and William Lower will be inducted into the Order of the Black Blazer, recognizing individuals for their contributions and support of UC Athletics, while Kimberlee Dobbs will receive the Strubbe Distinguished Service Award. 
The top student-athletes from each of UC's 19 varsity sports will be honored. The selection for Legion of Excellence is based on the highest cumulative grade-point average on the respective team for the previous school year and good academic standing within the individual's athletics team and college. 
The 2015 LOE honorees are: 
Baseball - Mitch Patishall 
Men’s Basketball - Zack Tobler 
Women’s Basketball - Jasmine Whitfield 
Men’s Cross Country - Toby Loveridge 
Women’s Cross Country - Amber McAlpine 
Football - Mason Antoun 
Men’s Golf - Jared O’Kelley 
Women’s Golf - Ashley Cassidy 
Lacrosse - Meg Gulmi 
Men’s Soccer - Nick Frank 
Women’s Soccer - Taylor Jackson 
Men’s Swimming - Mitch Beerse 
Women’s Swimming - Milli Puth 
Tennis - Kelly Poggensee-Wei 
Men’s Track & Field - Kevin Konkoly 
Women’s Track & Field - April McPherson 
Volleyball - Emma Roberson 
2015 JAMES P. KELLY UC ATHLETICS HALL OF FAME BIOS 
Danny Fortson (Men’s Basketball/1995-97) 
A power player with a soft shooting touch, Danny Fortson (1995-97) led the Bearcats in scoring all three seasons while developing into a consensus first team All-American and the program's second all-time leading scorer, now third. Fortson was named a first team All-American by the Associated Press, Basketball Times, Basketball Weekly, National Association of Basketball Coaches and the Basketball Writers Association at the conclusion of the 1996-97 season when he averaged 21.3 points and 9.1 rebounds while shooting 62.0 percent from the field. 
As a sophomore during the 1995-96 campaign, Fortson averaged 20.1 points and 9.6 rebounds while being selected a consensus second team All-American. 
A two-time Conference USA Player of the Year who helped lead the Bearcats to league crowns in 1996 and 1997, Fortson ended his UC career second in points (1,881) and free throws made (571), third in field goal shooting percentage (.565) and 10th in rebounds (873). 
A native of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, Fortson was the 10th pick in the 1997 NBA Draft by Milwaukee before being traded to Denver. Fortson went on to play for six organizations and averaged 8.2 points and 7.2 rebounds during his 10-year NBA career. He averaged a double-double in points and rebounds in three of his first five seasons in the league. He was also selected as a member of the 2016 Ohio Basketball Hall of Fame Class. 
Dr. Nancy Hamant (Contributor/Academics) 
Nancy Russell Hamant, associate professor emerita, longtime Faculty Athletics Representative and alumna of the UC College of Education, Criminal Justice, and Human Services (CECH), dedicated her career and her adult life to supporting the University of Cincinnati. 
Before retiring in 2007, Hamant spent 43 years preparing UC students for future teaching careers and as coordinator of Professional Practice, placed thousands of students in teaching positions. 
She earned her BA in history and education in 1957 on a classics scholarship from the McMicken College of Arts & Sciences (A&S), earned a master’s degree in educational administration from the UC College of Education, Criminal Justice, and Human Services (CECH) in 1961, and earned her doctorate in educational administration in 1967, working as a part-time instructor. She became a full-time UC faculty member in teacher education in 1964 and remained a faculty member at CECH until her retirement in 2007. 
Hamant’s dedication to the university has spanned beyond the college classroom. Her service has included representation as chair of the University Athletic Committee; faculty representative to the NCAA; Faculty Senate representative; secretary of the American Association of University Professors (AAUP) Bargaining Council; vice president of the AAUP; and service with accreditation for the North Central Association. 
She is a UC Foundation Emerita Trustee and lifetime member, former board member and past president of the UC Alumni Association. She is an active member of UC’s Charles McMicken Society (life benefactor and founder); the Herman Schneider Legacy Society (Legacy Benefactor); UCATS (George Smith Society); the C-Club; Order of the Black Blazer; the Ad Hoc Committee on University Governance; and serves as co-chair for the Proudly Cincinnati Campaign Leadership Committee for CECH. She served as honorary co-chair for the “We’re All UC” Faculty/Staff Campaign in 2006. 
Hamant was honored with the UC Alumni Distinguished Service Award in 1982, the UC Foundation Trustee Award in 1998 and was named Faculty Member of the Year in 2001 by the UC Alumni Association. She received the CECH Distinguished Alumni Award in 2001 and the Faculty Senate University Service Award in 2006 and the Proudly Cincinnati Campaign in 2008. She was awarded the University of Cincinnati Award for Excellence in 2009 
Her civic affiliations include membership in numerous education professional organizations. She has also served as president of the Hamilton County Park District Board of Commissioners. 
Josh Harrison (Baseball/2006-08) Had at least one hit in all but 34 of 173 career games ... ranks among the UC leaders in average (4th, .358), at bats (8th, 687), runs (3rd, 192), hits (4th, 246), doubles (4th, 53), RBI (5th, 153), total bases (5th, 366), stolen bases (2nd, 63), walks (20th, 80) sacrifice flies (1st, 21), slugging percentage (15th, .533) and on-base percentage (5th, .439) ... tabbed the 2008 BIG EAST Co-Player of the Year and a second team All-American by Collegiate Baseball ... ranked among the BIG EAST leaders in average, runs, hits, doubles, total bases, RBI and stolen bases ... hit .467 with six runs, two doubles, a triple, five runs and three steals to earn a spot on the BIG EAST Championship All-Tournament Team ... was a Second-Team All-BIG EAST selection in 2007 and was a third-team choice in 2006 ... earned ABCA Second-Team All-Region status in 2007 and was a Louisville Slugger Freshman All-American in 2006 ... Drafted by the Chicago Cubs in the 6th round (191st overall) of the MLB Draft ... now plays for the Pittsburgh Pirates. Was selected as an MLB All-Star in 2014. 
Jim Herman (Men’s Golf/1997-2000) 
At Cincinnati (1997-2000): Two-time All-Conference USA selection (1998, 2000) … led all UC scorers in 28 tournaments during his career, winning four events … carded the lowest stroke average on the team in three of four years with the Bearcats … posted a 73.0 stroke average as a senior in 2000, which was the lowest average registered at UC since 1961 … finished with a 75.2 career stroke average … his single-round 66 score remains tied for second lowest in school history. 
Professional Career: Has registered 11 top-25 finishes and four top-10 finishes in his career on the PGA Tour (2010-Present), winning nearly $1.7 million … has qualified for three US Open events, making the cut twice while tying for 47th place at the event in 2010 …. carded his best finish on the PGA Tour at the Zurich Classic of New Orleans in April 2015, tying for fourth … other top-10 finishes on the PGA Tour include tying for seventh at the 2015 Honda Classic, tying for ninth at the 2013 Sanderson Farms Championship and tying for 10th at the 2013 TPC Deere Run … owns 32 top-25 finishes, 11 top-10 finishes and one victory on the Web.com Tour (2008-2014), winning nearly $700,000 … won the 2010 Moonah Classic on the Web.com Tour … qualified for the Nationwide Tour after tying for 74th place at the 2007 PGA Tour Qualifying Tournament. 
Personal: born Nov. 5, 1977 in Cincinnati, Ohio … attended St. Xavier High School in Cincinnati. 
Maria (Oberg) Vitazka (Swimming/1998-2002) 
Debuted as a freshman by winning the 500 and 1650 freestyles at the NIC championships … repeated as 500 and 1650 titlist as a sophomore, reaching UC Top Five all-time marks in both events…earned All-American honors in the 500 free and honorable mention All-American honors in the 1650 at the NCAAs as a junior…set UC marks in the 500, 1,000 and 1,650…capped career with All-American awards in the 500 (5th at the NCAAs), 1,650 (15th) and 200 freestyle (16th)…added 200 freestyle to her list of school records and contributed to record in the 200 medley relay…won 200, 500 and 1650 freestyles at the first-ever C-USA Championships, leading UC to the title, earning C-USA Swimmer of the Year honors … native of Sjobo, Sweden. 
Bill Walker (Contributor/Sports Medicine) 
Bill Walker oversaw the health care of UC’s student-athletes for almost 32 years, serving a legion of former Beracats ... Served as UC’s head athletic trainer from Dec. 1975 until July 2007 ... was promoted to Assistant AD in 1998 ... directly responsible for the growth and expansion of UC’s athletic training department ... saw the transition of the Bearcats through six different training rooms, including the current one inside Varsity Village ... Past President of Greater Cincinnati Athletic Trainers’ Association ... Athletic trainer, Pan American Games 1987 ... Also served as Head Athletic Trainer for the Shreveport Steamers of the World Football League ... B.S. Health Education, Austin Peay State University (1973); M.A. Health Education, Tennessee Tech (1975) ... Founding member of the Ohio Athletic Trainers’ Association ... Earned OATA’s Most Distinguished Athletic Trainer Award in 2011 ... Elected to the Ohio Athletic Trainers Hall of Fame in 1998 ... Outstanding Contribution to Education, College of Education 1993 ... US Army Bronze Star, Army Commendation, Vietnam Campaign Medal, Vietnam Service Medal (Three Stars). Related Stories
